nodes.text: Machine learning classifiers applied to CT-image-based features can enable early and accurate detection of lung cancer
The proposed diagnostic system combines image-processing stages with multi-stage classification to detect lung cancer and stage malignancy
This study evaluates three classifiers: K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN), Support Vector Machine (SVM) and Random Forest for lung cancer classification
Experimental training and validation used LIDC-IDRI CT dataset plus small local samples (AHRC, AIMS), with 500 images, 70/30 train-test split and 5-fold cross-validation
Performance evaluation across accuracy, precision, recall, F1, TPR, FPR and ROC-AUC determines which classifier best discriminates cancerous vs non-cancerous cases
Image preprocessing pipeline includes contrast enhancement (CLAHE), Wiener, adaptive Gaussian, Gaussian and Gabor filtering, resizing and normalization
Segmentation and enhancement use thresholding and marker-controlled watershed; the system classifies detected lesions into early, intermediate and advanced stages
SVM achieved average accuracy 95.06% using 5-fold cross-validation on the experimental setup
KNN achieved average accuracy 86.89% under the same experimental conditions
Random Forest achieved average accuracy 81.96% under the same experimental conditions
Reported per-class ROC-AUC values exceed 0.99, indicating very high discrimination ability across classes
Findings were validated with local samples from AHRC and AIMS and reviewed under supervision of a radiologist to corroborate results
Compared to selected prior works, the proposed model reports higher accuracy (proposed 95.05% vs cited works ranging 76.9%â€“86%)
Conclusion: SVM is the best-performing classifier in this study and shows potential for early-stage lung cancer detection; future work requires larger, more diverse datasets to improve reliability
Limitation: The study used a relatively small sample size (500 images) and limited diversity, which constrains generalizability and motivates collection of more comprehensive data
